replies.msg: Don't bro me when you don't know me. Reading a classic doesn't mean you are adept in the language, and not being able to understand Shakespearean doesn't mean you are illiterate. In fact, modern literacy is far different from Shakespearean English. For you to put European renaissance literature, something the States teach in middle school, on such a high pedestal shows how "good" your English is. From your post history I can already make the bold assumption that you most likely picked up a "No Fear Shakespeare" that translated Shakespearean into modern English and I highly doubt you would be able to understand even 20% of Shakespearean on your own.

覺唔覺唔識打中文嘅香港人仲柒? (可能你唔係香港人啦)

illiterate (adj.)
early 15c., "uneducated, unable to read and write" (originally meaning Latin), from Latin illiteratus "unlearned, unlettered, ignorant; without culture, inelegant," from assimilated form of in- "not, opposite of" (see in- (1)) + literatus "educated," literally "furnished with letters" (see literate). Old English used unstæfwis as a loan-translation of Latin illiteratus. As a noun meaning "illiterate person" from 1620s. Hence, illiterati (1788, Horace Walpole).

唔洗理佢 今本得香港人先會笑香港人，冇自信要四圍R 自信。Ching 唔好失望，學習係過程，你有一日都可以英文好到native 咁

replies.msg:
我由一個英文書都睇唔明啲人去到native level , 去到美國冇人知我係foreigner , 我得你都一樣得

1. 上reddit, 睇中意啲片(最好可以放慢)，開subtitles , 有字唔識就google ，有時可能會見到idioms，所以明明每隻字都識但一齊就唔明，好正常，好在有google. 寫低學咗嘅字然後得閒睇，好快就入晒腦

2. Grammar 唔洗理，只要睇得多用得多英文就入腦，睇咸片學英文仲快過你用grammar 書

3. 冇鬼佬friend 唔緊要，Download mafia mystery ，挽住game 同鬼仔吹水，訓練output 英文啲speed 。用英文啲時候記得試吓忙記中文啲語法。

口音：佢講完你又講，講到一樣為止，Cambridge dictionary 好好，有英國同美國口音之分，比你慢慢學。同埋試下用學佐啲口音唱英文歌，train 自己

最好啲學習方法就係make mistakes 然後不斷學習不斷改!

正常人係唔會好似樓主咁恥笑人，係因為冇自信要R 自信，所以由得佢地自我感覺良好當幫下人 心理學有學名叫做呢個心理叫做Schadenfreude
巴打加油! 所有人都有個開始，每日學D，不知不覺就會變得好好
我覺得打錯中文嘅人都好杘
唔覺，中文差嘅人先柒。
Yes la on99 diu lee low mo know eng is the best yeah
英文唔算叻，淨係識deepthroat, milf, gangbang, anal, boobs呢啲

quote.msg: I'm no elitist but anyone who can't read Shakespeare with ease should not considered illiterate...
Should not be considered

btw something like "perhaps you should count yourself one" would be more succinct and natural. You've finished primary school (I suppose so) and you don't need a concrete noun every few words lest Miss Wong should scold you for pretensions to being advanced.

btw something like "perhaps you should count yourself as one" would be more succinct and natural. You've finished primary school (I suppose so) and , thereforeyou don't no longer need a concrete noun every few words (not true) lest Miss Wong should scold you for pretensions to being advanced (improper use lmao).

...Fuck me. Just read a book bro. Real book not ESL notes. Dickens whatever, just close your eyes and pick one from any series titled 'classics' something and read it. You simply can't read, write, let alone think in English. I feel embarrassed for you bro..

replies.msg:
自以為好有文化，其實連個唔字都唔識。
鐘意用英文你咪去4chan, Reddit
仲有，
Ceux qui ne parlent pas français sont des porcs sans culture.

quote.msg: 唔洗理佢 今本得香港人先會笑香港人，冇自信要四圍R 自信。Ching 唔好失望，學習係過程，你有一日都可以英文好到native 咁
學唔識呀,好傻豬

我由一個英文書都睇唔明啲人去到native level , 去到美國冇人知我係foreigner , 我得你都一樣得

1. 上reddit, 睇中意啲片(最好可以放慢)，開subtitles , 有字唔識就google ，有時可能會見到idioms，所以明明每隻字都識但一齊就唔明，好正常，好在有google. 寫低學咗嘅字然後得閒睇，好快就入晒腦

2. Grammar 唔洗理，只要睇得多用得多英文就入腦，睇咸片學英文仲快過你用grammar 書

3. 冇鬼佬friend 唔緊要，Download mafia mystery ，挽住game 同鬼仔吹水，訓練output 英文啲speed 。用英文啲時候記得試吓忙記中文啲語法。

口音：佢講完你又講，講到一樣為止，Cambridge dictionary 好好，有英國同美國口音之分，比你慢慢學。同埋試下用學佐啲口音唱英文歌，train 自己

最好啲學習方法就係make mistakes 然後不斷學習不斷改!

正常人係唔會好似樓主咁恥笑人，係因為冇自信要R 自信，所以由得佢地自我感覺良好當幫下人 心理學有學名叫做呢個心理叫做Schadenfreude
巴打加油! 所有人都有個開始，每日學D，不知不覺就會變得好好

就好似中文咁 你唔會理啲咩主語動詞你都會講得到

Btw 語言係要嚟溝通既

quote.msg: btw something like "perhaps you should count yourself as one" would be more succinct and natural. You've finished primary school (I suppose so) and , thereforeyou don't no longer need a concrete noun every few words (not true) lest Miss Wong should scold you for pretensions to being advanced (improper use lmao).

...Fuck me. Just read a book bro. Real book not ESL notes. Dickens whatever, just close your eyes and pick one from any series titled 'classics' something and read it. You simply can't read, write, let alone think in English. I feel embarrassed for you bro..

Don't bro me when you don't know me. Reading a classic doesn't mean you are adept in the language, and not being able to understand Shakespearean doesn't mean you are illiterate. In fact, modern literacy is far different from Shakespearean English. For you to put European renaissance literature, something the States teach in middle school, on such a high pedestal shows how "good" your English is. From your post history I can already make the bold assumption that you most likely picked up a "No Fear Shakespeare" that translated Shakespearean into modern English and I highly doubt you would be able to understand even 20% of Shakespearean on your own.

quote.msg: Except the first one wasn't just a wording error, but also grammatically incorrect. The same could be said about this response. Perhaps you can try making such bold statements after you finish your ESL crash course! Good luck! I believe in you!
Today I learned that the word illiterate doesn't exist. It's a conspiracy and people have been deceived..

Oh the word illiterate DOES exist. But it just mean the exact opposite of what you are trying to get across.

It's just like relevant and irrelevant.

replies.msg: My whole point was that if a person typed "should not considered illiterate" and corrected it to "should be considered illiterate" five seconds later, the most likely scenario would be that he typed the former in an act of simple and obvious carelessness. If you two geniuses and others who seize on it can't even get that, it's not even about English anymore (though your sentences do pain one's eyes to read). You're just plainly terribly dumb.
